items.title: No Wales issue for 'best player' Davies - Bellamy
items.summary: Ben Davies' limited game-time at Spurs is no issue for Wales, for whom he remains the "best player", says head coach Craig Bellamy.

items.title: Why the NFL play-offs are the 'most unusual' in years
items.summary: Even NFL veterans are struggling to call this season's play-offs, with so many big names out and an array of young stars ready to battle for Super Bowl glory.

items.title: 'No idea what just happened' - GB's Jones battles injury in Auckland win
items.summary: Britain's Francesca Jones says she had "no idea what just happened" after battling injury to reach the Auckland Classic quarter-finals.

items.title: Stokes suffers adductor injury in final Ashes Test
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes leaves with the field with a right adductor injury on day four of the fifth Ashes Test against Australia in Sydney

items.title: 'Born to play international cricket' - how Bethell came of age
items.summary: Jacob Bethell looks "born to play international cricket" and came of age with his maiden Test century in the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Bethell scores stunning century but England edge towards defeat
items.summary: Jacob Bethell's stunning maiden first-class century gave England an Ashes silver lining but could not prevent the tourists from sliding towards defeat in the fifth Test against Australia.

items.title: Ravens sack Harbaugh after 18 years as head coach
items.summary: The Baltimore Ravens end John Harbaugh's 18-year spell as head coach after the team's failure to reach the NFL play-offs.

items.title: Neymar extends Santos deal in bid for World Cup spot
items.summary: Neymar extends his Santos deal until the end of 2026 as Brazil's all-time leading goalscorer seeks to earn a World Cup call-up.

items.title: 'It hurts, it hurts a lot' - Skivington on pain of Gloucester slump
items.summary: Under-pressure George Skivington says he is enduring the hardest spell of his decade-long coaching career after Gloucester's miserable form continued with defeat away to Newcastle Red Bulls on Friday.

items.title: O'Neill can inspire Celtic to success - Craigan
items.summary: Celtic "stand a better chance" of retaining the Scottish Premiership with Martin O'Neill's appointment as manager until the end of the season, according to former Northern Ireland international Stephen Craigan.

items.title: 'Magnificent innings' - Bethell makes first Test century
items.summary: Watch the best of Jacob Bethell as he makes his maiden first-class century on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Lenovoâ€™s Legion Pro Rollable Gaming Laptop Goes Ultrawide at the Press of a Key
items.summary: Lenovo brought a Legion gaming laptop to CES this year with a rollable OLED display that expands horizontally by six inches.

items.title: Motorola Razr Fold Book-Style Foldable: Specs, Details, Release Date
items.summary: At CES 2026, the company also announced a new smartwatch, stylus, Bluetooth tracker, and even a weird AI pendant.

items.title: Crawley trapped lbw in first over playing no shot
items.summary: Mitchell Starc strikes in the first over yet again as Zak Crawley is trapped lbw for one, having made no attempt at playing a shot, to leave England 4-1 on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: 'An impossible task?' Winless run leaves West Ham facing drop
items.summary: Booed off the pitch after conceding a late winner at home against their relegation rivals and on a 10-game winless run - these are desperate times for West Ham.

items.title: Tottenham completely aligned, says Frank
items.summary: Head coach Thomas Frank says Tottenham are "completely aligned" about the future as he faces pressure from fans to improve results.

items.title: 'It's happened!' - Smith is finally dismissed for 138
items.summary: Josh Tongue takes the wicket of Steve Smith, as the Australian batter is caught behind for 138 to leave his side on 544-8 with a lead of 160 runs on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: 'His day may be over' - Stokes leaves the field with groin injury
items.summary: Ben Stokes is forced off the field with a groin injury in the middle of his 28th over, on day four of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Rangers have dragged themselves back into title race - but Rohl wants more
items.summary: Rangers have made a "statement" by moving to within three points of Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts - but head coach Danny Rohl says moving above Celtic into second place is "still not what we want".

items.title: Rangers have dragged themselves back into title race - but Rohl wants more
items.summary: Rangers have made a "statement" by moving to within three points of Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts - but head coach Danny Rohl says moving above Celtic into second place is "still not what we want".

items.title: We had the mentality to get the job done - Dyche
items.summary: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche was happy with the "grit and determination" his side showed to come from behind to beat relegation-threatened West Ham.

items.title: West Ham relegation fight 'not over' - Nuno
items.summary: West Ham manager Nuno Espirito Santo reflects on his side's defeat by Nottingham Forest, insisting their relegation fight is "not over" with the Hammers seven points adrift of safety.

items.title: Newcastle face Strand Larsen battle - Wednesday's gossip
items.summary: Newcastle United could have to compete with Totteham if they want Wolves striker Jorgen Strand Larsen, Roma interest in Joshua Zirkzee complicated by Manchester United sacking Ruben Amorim and Liverpool unlikely to let Federico Chiesa leave in January.

items.title: Late Gibbs-White penalty sinks helpless Hammers
items.summary: A late Morgan Gibbs-White penalty gave Nottingham Forest a crucial away victory over West Ham, leaving the London side seven points adrift of safety.

items.title: Interim manager Fletcher sought Ferguson 'blessing'
items.summary: Darren Fletcher says he sought the blessing of his old Manchester United boss Sir Alex Ferguson before taking interim charge at the Old Trafford club.

items.title: Grok Is Pushing AI â€˜Undressingâ€™ Mainstream
items.summary: Paid tools that â€œstripâ€ clothes from photos have been available on the darker corners of the internet for years. Elon Muskâ€™s X is now removing barriers to entryâ€”and making the results public.

items.title: The Best 65 Brand-New & Top Delish Membership Recipes
Lentil Salad
'How can all of this be happening?': Scientists spot massive group of ancient galaxies so hot they shouldn't exist
items.summary: An inexplicably hot, fast-growing cluster of galaxies in the early universe has scientists questioning theories of galactic evolution.

items.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
items.summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

items.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
items.summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

items.title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
items.summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
